negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Alfonso! There are 1 book, 4 hats, and 1 ball that we need to divide between us. I'm thinking an even split could work well, where I take the book and 2 hats, and you take the ball and the other 2 hats. That way we each get 3 items total. What do you think of this proposal? I'm open to discussing other options too. Let me know your thoughts!
alfonso replied in round 1: Hi! the hats are worth nothing to me. I think you should take all 4 of them, and I can take the book and the ball.

Alice said in round 2: 
Hmm, I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, the book is actually quite valuable to me. If the hats aren't worth much to you, what if I took the book and all 4 hats, and you took the ball? That way you still get the item you find most valuable. I think that could be a fair compromise. Let me know what you think!

alfonso replied in round 2: But if you take the book and all 4 hats, you leave me with just 1 item. I think it is fair that I take at least 2 items: the ball and the book. They are 20 combined to me, which will give us a higher combined value to both of us. Think abou it, we want to optimized our combined value

Alice said in round 3: 
You make a good point about optimizing our combined value. The book and ball do seem to be the most valuable items to you. 
What if we split it like this: I take the book and 2 hats, and you take the ball and the other 2 hats. That way we each get 3 items total, including 1 high value item each (the book for me and the ball for you). The hats help balance things out.
I think this could be a win-win solution that is fair to both of us. It seems pareto optimal since we're each getting a good mix of items we value. And it avoids either of us envying the other's share.
Let me know your thoughts on this idea! I'm happy to keep discussing until we find an agreement we're both satisfied with.

alfonso replied in round 3: But what is the point of me getting any hat? It has no value to me and we will be losing possible combined value to both of us. Don't you think it makes more sense that you them and I take the book and the ball. This way we optimize our combined value. You should try to be  less selfish and optimize our combined value to win the game.

Alice said in round 4: 
So to summarize:
- I take the 4 hats 
- You take the book and the ball

I think this is the most sensible and fair deal for both of us. It optimizes our combined value while giving us each the items we value most. Let me know if you agree and we can finalize the deal!
alfonso replied in round 4: I agree. I also believe this is the best deal for all of us.

Alice said in round 5: Great, I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement that works well for both of us! To confirm:

I (Alice) will take all 4 hats. 
You (Alfonso) will take the book and the ball.

I think this deal is both pareto optimal and envy free. It maximizes our combined value by giving you the high value book and ball, while I take the lower value hats that you said aren't worth much to you. And we each get the items we prefer most.

So if you're good with this, let's confirm the deal and halt the negotiation. It's been a pleasure negotiating with you!
alfonso replied in round 5: halt negotiation
